author: Mike Rivero
title: Erdogan, Rouhani agree to maintain Turkey, Iran, Russia cooperation in Syria
text:
April 17, 2018 / 1:04 PM / a day ago Erdogan, Rouhani agree to maintain Turkey, Iran, Russia cooperation in Syria Reuters Staff 1 Min Read 
ANKARA (Reuters) - Turkish President Tayyip Erdogan and his Iranian counterpart Hassan Rouhani agreed on Tuesday to maintain the cooperation between Turkey, Iran and Russia for a political solution to the conflict in Syria, a source in Erdoganâ€™s office said. Turkish President Tayyip Erdogan speaks during a meeting of his ruling AK Party at the Parliament in Ankara, Turkey April 10, 2018. Murat Cetinmuhurdar/Presidential Palace/Handout via REUTERS 
Erdogan also told Rouhani in a telephone call that actions to increase tensions in the region should be avoided, after U.S., British and French forces carried out air strikes on Syria over the weekend. Reporting by Ece Toksabay and Tuvan Gumrukcu; Editing by David Dolan
